item.title: Olympic Pictograms Through the Ages
item.description:
Olympic Pictograms Through the Ages

Very fun video from The New York Times. Designer Steven Heller traces the evolution of the tiny symbols for each Olympic sport since their appearance in 1936.

item.title: Design Methods - toolkit Design Method Toolkit for multidisciplinary design research, developed by MediaLAB Amsterdam
item.description:
Design Methods - toolkit Design Method Toolkit for multidisciplinary design research, developed by MediaLAB Amsterdam

A one-on-one interview is an interview between a researcher and a participant in a face-to-face situation.

item.title: Nike: Find Your Greatness
item.description:
Nike: Find Your Greatness

Nike's 2012 "Find Your Greatness" campaign. Bravo!

item.title: Liam - An Innovation Story
item.description:
Liam - An Innovation Story

True innovation means considering what happens to a product at every stage of its life cycle. Liam disassembles your iPhone when it's no longer functioning, so the materials inside can live on. http://apple.co/1SdvFbJ

item.title: How to Type Indian Rupee Symbol INR in HTML and MS Word
item.description:
How to Type Indian Rupee Symbol INR in HTML and MS Word

Indian currency is called Rupee or Rupiya. Indian government launched a new symbol for the Indian currency on 15 July 2010. Now that we a new Indian Rupee symbol, we also need to know how to type it in computer applications like MS Word, MS Excel, HTML web pages or in plain text.

item.title: How Designers Destroyed the World (Mike Monteiro)
item.description:
How Designers Destroyed the World (Mike Monteiro)

Designers have a responsibility, not only to themselves and to their clients, but also to the wider world. We are designers because we love to create, but creation without responsibility breeds destruction. Every day, designers all over the world work on projects without giving any thought or consideration to the impact that work has on the world around them.

item.title: A Bag For Every Day of the Year
item.description:
A Bag For Every Day of the Year

Designed for professionals, jet setters, digital nomads, travellers, and adventurers, the NÃ³mada is the perfect 3-way bag that effortlessly changes between backpack, briefcase and carry-on with an innovative modularized system to satisfy all 365 days of your ever-changing lifestyle! After all, routine is boring! We're talking inside and out...

item.title: Uber Rebrands: The story of bits and atoms
item.description:
Uber Rebrands: The story of bits and atoms

But then why is there a disconnect? Is it just resistant to the change? I have been doing back and forth on this but there are some interesting perspectives to look at. Having a clear design vision or good start point for your design process is great, but how does Uber's product and marketing strategies convert into its visual renaissance?

item.title: Addiction
item.description:
Addiction

What causes addiction? Easy, right? Drugs cause addiction. But maybe it is not that simple. This video is adapted from Johann Hari's New York Times best-selling book 'Chasing The Scream: The First and Last Days of the War on Drugs.'
